p: Hence, in the present study, the hydrodistillation method was proved to be better than maceration method for this novel herb. The hydrodistillation method for O. vulgare has been found to affect the quantity and quality of the essential oil obtained.[ 27 28 29 30] It has been observed by Kawase et al.[ 31] that when compared to other techniques, the quantity of the essential oil and its phytochemicals may contain higher concentration of active components. This could be the reason for the difference where essential oil of O. vulgare from hydrodistillation process showed better efficacy than extracts from maceration among Candida species.
